column30: Share your thoughts or comments towards the conversational agent or virtual museum  here, if any:
For me, the museum logo to start the chat is a little bit hard to find cause it's small and outside the museum interface.

column24: I had two issues when using the chabot: 1. sometimes the chabot responded lately such that the answer to the former question was given after I asked the follow-up question; 2. It seems that sometimes the chabot cannot recognize my order like "finish the vsiting."
column28: The virtual museum was amazingly designed with marvellous masterpieces and in-depth background information of each. The chabot, in general, did his job well, except for the two issues aforementioned.

column24: Once I waited forever for an answer, so I clicked a different option and it worked again (but I never got a reply to my first question). I also found that once it recommended me a similar painting "because both depict black people" although one painting didn't (it was dam square), so that wasn't quite accurate in my opinion.
column28:
First of all, really cool first steps towards a museum guide agent! Lots of potential :) My main issues are: 
- It should be more flexible with input, e.g. it didn't accept "portrait of a man", but only "Portrait of a Man", which is easy to fix
- I gave up on text input, and instead only used buttons. For usability/ease of use all forms of input should have a purpose, so if text input isn't helpful in the first place, I'd leave it out completely! Alternatively, if text input works better, I can imagine that I'd prefer it to buttons.
- I felt a bit lost on how to start, so perhaps an example interaction with the agent before starting could be useful. E.g. how to ask about genre of the painting? I couldn't find out quickly, because asking it just resulted in "what did you say?" (or something similar)
- If the agent doesn't know what you mean, it could be good to give a suggestion on how to rephrase or what the problem could be. E.g.: I could not find a painting of that name, try using capitalization correctly! Or, "Maybe you'd like to know something about painting x, perhaps -> genre -> related paintings"... this kind of thing! I think that would already be a great help.

Good luck, this is super cool!

column30: It is also expected to add the audio guide during the visiting
